8 passengers who had travelled on AP Sampark Kranti Express from Delhi to Ramagundam on 13th March have tested positive of COVID-19 yesterday.

Passengers are advised to avoid non essential travel for the safety of fellow citizens

Railways has found some cases of Coronavirus infected passengers in trains which makes train travel risky. 

Avoid train travel as you may also get infected if your co-passenger has Coronavirus. 

Postpone all journeys and keep yourself and your loved ones safe. #NoRailTravel

Year of ‘Grit and Victories’ for Indian Railways: Indian Railways has passed an unprecedented  year with amazing grit and achieved tremendous results in terms of  development of infrastructure , innovation, capacity expansion  freight diversification  and operational efficiency

Incredible performance in freight loading: Y’day, Solapur Division of CR also has loaded more than last year till now. With this, 36 divisions of Indian Railways have loaded more than LY. Freight loading deficit has reduced to about 2.5%. IR is confident of surpassing LY loading
